We are pleased to share that the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between IKP Knowledge Park and ACCESS Health International (AHI) was exchanged on July 18, 2025, at The Narayanan Vaghul Building, IKP Park Office, Genome Valley, Hyderabad.

This collaboration marks a significant milestone in advancing healthcare innovation and technology transfer between India and Egypt, with a focus on:

ğŸ”¹ Innovation scouting, IP strategy, and cross-border commercialization
ğŸ”¹ Localisation and regulatory alignment for biosimilars, oncology, vaccines, and immunosuppressants
ğŸ”¹ Supporting Egyptâ€™s national direction to localise Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (APIs) and Intermediates (IPIs)

This partnership is set to enable joint IP services, regulatory capacity building, innovation scouting, and global market access for startups and researchers. It cements a new bridge between Indian and Egyptian innovation ecosystems, working together to deliver global impact in life sciences and public health.

Driving Indiaâ€™s Scientific Leadership Towards 2047 

At the Joint Review of Science Ministries, Honâ€™ble Minister Dr. Jitendra Singh spotlighted the #BioE3 Policy as a key driver for biomanufacturing, green growth, and employment generation. BIRAC participated in "Hack4Health", organised by IIITD Innovation & Incubation Center. The event aimed to empower student innovators to take their first steps toward developing impactful, viable and scalable Deep tech healthcare solutions

Dr. Sonali Tandon, BIRAC participated in the panel discussion "Growing Importance of AI in Healthcare: Are We Ready for It?" along with Dr. Dr. Vinish Kathuria (Partner, SenseAI Ventures, Co-founder Rank Software Inc, Investor), Dr. Bharat Aggarwal (Principal Director, Radiology, Max Healthcare), Prof. Neetu Singh (Head, CBME, IIT Delhi) and Rajeev Gautam (President, HORIBA India)

The panel discussion centred on the increasing importance and benefits of AI in healthcare, as well as the challenges and opportunities in this field. Dr. Sonali Tandon highlighted the role of BIRAC and DBT in enabling India's biotechnology ecosystem to embrace the wave of AI and how aspiring entrepreneurs can benefit from it.

#Hack4Health #PanelDiscussion #Biotechnology #Challenges #AI #NewAgeHealthcare

ğŸŒŸ Congratulations to Deep Algorithms Solutions on raising â‚¹10.8 Cr (approx. $1.25M) in Seed Funding led by Unicorn India Ventures! ğŸŒŸ

We are proud to share that Deep Algorithms Solutions, one of our incubated portfolio startups at IIT Mandi Catalyst, has successfully raised â‚¹10.8 crore ($1.25 million) in a seed funding round led by Unicorn India Ventures, with participation from several esteemed angel investors.

Founded by J P Mishra in December 2021, Deep Algorithms Solutions is a pioneering behavioral cybersecurity and AI startup committed to tackling sophisticated cyber fraud. The startup leverages indigenous AI and behavioral intelligence to address critical challenges in digital identity security and real-time application protection.

This milestone funding reinforces confidence in their vision and the impactful problem they are solving â€” Identity Security and Real-Time Application Security powered by AI and Behavioral Intelligence.

ğŸ’¥ More power to the team as they continue to innovate and protect the digital world!

SIDBI(Small Industries Development Bank of India) and Society for Innovation & Entrepreneurship -SINE IIT Bombay today hosted a thought-provoking brainstorming session on "Strengthening Investment Capabilities of Incubators."ğŸ¤

Key highlights of the sessions:
-Investment experience sharing by SIDBI-backed incubators.
-Building an investment offering at the University/Institutions level.
-Building a fund housed at the incubator
-Panel Discussion: How to build funds for success and attract capital?
-Incubating a collaborative platform to set up and support a university-housed VC fund in India.

Several insights and suggestions were shared by the speakers during the session. The highlight of the day was SIDBI's commitment to build investment capabilities at incubator level across India.

The deliberations sparked compelling ideas on establishing university-linked venture capital funds which can beÂ transformative for Indiaâ€™s innovation landscape and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

ğŸ“Š Thank You, Dr. Raghunandan NK! ğŸ’¡

ğŸ™ We at DERBI Foundation extend our sincere appreciation to Dr. Raghunandan N K for conducting a high-impact workshop on the Business Model Canvas (BMC) for our startup cohort.

ğŸ•´ The session offered deep insights into how startups can move beyond traditional business planning to embrace flexible, iterative, and value-driven models. 

ğŸª From refining the value proposition and customer segmentation to mapping key metrics, pricing strategies, and leveraging unfair advantages, the workshop equipped our founders with practical tools to build, test, and evolve their models.

Key highlights included:
 âœ… Understanding the BMC framework and its adaptability
 âœ… The Build-Measure-Learn loop in validating startup assumptions
 âœ… Identifying customer pain points and market demand
 âœ… Real-life examples that grounded theory in startup reality

Thank you, Dr. Raghunandan, for empowering our startups with the clarity and structure needed to navigate their growth with confidence and strategy!

As Indiaâ€™s agriculture sector grapples with climate uncertainty, water stress, and rising input costs, the need for resilient, scalable innovations has never been more urgent.Â  

Krishi Mangal, an initiative by Social Alpha and Cisco CSR, is looking for start-ups working to shape the future of agriculture. 

Now in its third edition, Krishi Mangal invites applications from start-ups developing affordable, scalable, and field-validated technologies that strengthen Indiaâ€™s agricultural resilience.Â  

The program is open to innovations solving for Integrated Farming Management, Soil Rejuvenation and Irrigation Management, Farm Mechanisation, Post-Harvest Management, and Livestock Waste Management.Â  

Applications close on 13th July 2025.Â Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony

#FarmingForward #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture #FarmersDeserveDeepTech

Indiaâ€™s livestock sector is growingâ€”but so is the waste it generates. 

Inadequate waste management leads to methane emissions, groundwater contamination, and health risks for farm-adjacent and farming communities.Â 
At the same time, this waste stream holds untapped valueâ€”from clean energy to soil health to circular inputs for agriculture. 

Weâ€™re inviting start-ups using AI/ML and IoT in developing solutions that: 

- Transform livestock waste into biogas, biofertilisers, or organic inputsÂ 
- Build decentralised, efficient processing systemsÂ 
- Reduce handling complexity and make adoption feasible for small farmersÂ 
- Enable climate-positive, income-generating uses of dairy or poultry waste 

Solutions should be scalable, sustainable, and relevant to low-resource rural or peri-urban contexts. 

Selected start-ups will receive funding, lab and prototyping support, incubation, expert mentorship, and access to implementation and capital partners. 

Applications close on 13th July 2025.Â Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony

#FarmingForward #LivestockWasteInnovation #CircularEconomy #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture

Venture Center was delighted to be part of the Royal Academy of Engineeringâ€™s Leadership in Innovation Fellowship (LIF) 2025 In-country Partner Training Program held in London from 6â€“11 July.

Pranoti Kulkarni represented Venture Center at this multi-day event that brought together in-country partners and over 70 innovators from across Asia, Africa, and Latin America. The program featured expert-led sessions on innovation policy, commercialization, sustainability, and scaling up. While there, Pranoti also had the chance to visit leading institutions such as Cambridge Cleantech and InnovationRCA, engaging with founders and innovation leaders. 

The event concluded with a high-energy pitch day. Weâ€™re proud to share that Module Innovations, a Venture Center-supported startup, was the winner of the prestigious Pitch Award at the Royal Academy of Engineering Leaders in Innovationâ€“Global 2025 Pitch Day, representing India among 70 innovators and startups from 9 countries.

Venture Center is proud to support innovation-driven entrepreneurship in partnership with global ecosystems like LIF and the Royal Academy of Engineering. Thank You for the opportunity.

Behind every medical breakthrough lies an uncomfortable truth: 90% of promising treatments that succeed in animals never work in humans. Why? Because animal models donâ€™t accurately reflect human responses.

Itâ€™s time for smarter testing. With tissue engineering, we can now grow real human tissues in the lab, which means faster drug development, better outcomes, and no animal harm.

At Venture Center, weâ€™re enabling this shift through cutting-edge facilities and services in tissue engineering. Connect with Venture Center to discover how we can help you! 

Contact Manish Gore, Ph.D. at: manish.gore@venturecenter.co.in

Premnath Venugopalan Mrunal K. Smita Kale BIRAC Regional Bioinnovation Center (BRBC) 

#tissueengineering #animalmodels #drugtesting

ğŸš¨ Startup Tip No. 2: Validate before you build

Got an app idea? A new product in mind?

Pause.

Before building anything, talk to 50 people.
âœ“ Understand their problems
âœ“ Learn how they currently solve it
âœ“ Ask if they'd pay for your solution

Your first milestone isnâ€™t a prototype; itâ€™s real conversations.

At VentureStudio, too many founders skip this step and build in the dark.

Validation saves you months of rework and regret.

Talk first. Build later.
